com.emc.ecs.nfsclient.rpc

Class Xdr

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emc.ecs.nfsclient.rpc.Xdr

  • public class Xdr
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the serialization and deserialization of primitive types into and out of a buffer, as specified in RFC 1014 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1014).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Xdr(byte[] data)
      Build an Xdr object for deserialization.
      Xdr(int size)
      Build an Xdr object for serialization.

      • skip

        public void skip(int count)
        Skip a number of bytes. Note that the count is rounded up to the next BLOCK_SIZE.
        Parameters:
        count - of the buffer in bytes

      • getBytes

        public void getBytes(int lengthToCopy,
                     byte[] copyArray,
                     int copyOffset)
        Get bytes from the xdr buffer to the input buffer
        Parameters:
        lengthToCopy - Number of bytes to copy.
        copyArray - Array to hold the copied data.
        copyOffset - Where to start the copy.

      • putByteArray

        public void putByteArray(byte[] b)
        Put a counted array of bytes into the buffer. Note that the entire byte array is encoded.
        Parameters:
        b - byte array

      • putByteArray

        public void putByteArray(byte[] b,
                         int len)
        Put a counted array of bytes into the buffer
        Parameters:
        b - byte array
        len - number of bytes to encode

      • putByteArray

        public void putByteArray(byte[] b,
                         int boff,
                         int len)
        Put a counted array of bytes into the buffer
        Parameters:
        b - byte array
        boff - offset into byte array
        len - number of bytes to encode

      • putByteArray

        public void putByteArray(Xdr x)
        Put an Xdr buffer into the buffer This is used to encode the RPC credentials
        Parameters:
        x - XDR buffer

      • putBytes

        public void putBytes(byte[] b,
                     int boff,
                     int len)
        Put a counted array of bytes into the buffer. The length is not encoded.
        Parameters:
        b - byte array
        boff - offset into byte array
        len - number of bytes to encode

      • getPayloads

        public java.util.List<java.nio.ByteBuffer> getPayloads()
